TowerDefense

Class CooldownTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • TowerDefense.CooldownTimer

  • public class CooldownTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    CooldownTimer represents a timer that counts down from a certain number of seconds to zero. Users can then check the timer to see if it is done or not. The timer can be reset and used again! This class used to be pretty straightforward, but then we added the ability to pause the game...
    Author:
    Branden Drake, Rachel Horton

    • Constructor Detail

      • CooldownTimer

        public CooldownTimer(float seconds)
        Constructor. Initializes the number of seconds to countdown from and starts the timer counting down.
        Parameters:
        seconds - The number of seconds to start the countdown from.

    • Method Detail

      • pauseAll

        public static void pauseAll()
        Indiscriminately pauses every CooldownTimer.

      • unpauseAll

        public static void unpauseAll()
        Indiscriminately unpauses every CooldownTimer.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns:
        True if this timer is in a paused state.

      • getCurrentPausedDuration

        public long getCurrentPausedDuration()
        Returns:
        The amount of time this timer has been in its current pause state.

      • pause

        public boolean pause()
        Pauses this timer.
        Returns:
        False if the timer was already paused.

      • unpause

        public boolean unpause()
        Unpauses this timer.
        Returns:
        False if this timer wasn't paused.

      • setDuration

        public void setDuration(float seconds)
        Set the number of seconds to countdown from next time. Note that this does not affect any currently active timers.
        Parameters:
        seconds - The number of seconds to start the next countdown from.

      • start

        public void start(float seconds)
        Start the timer from a set number of seconds. If the timer is already being used, tosses out the old countdown and replaces it with this new one.
        Parameters:
        seconds - The number of seconds to start the countdown from.

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the timer from the last set number of seconds. If the timer is already being used, tosses out the old countdown and replaces it with this new one.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Checks whether the timer has finished its countdown.
        Returns:
        True if the timer has reached zero.

      • getSecondsRemaining

        public long getSecondsRemaining()
        Gets the number of seconds until this timer will be done.
        Returns:
        The amount of seconds left until this timer will be done.
